column2: The Engineer, Customer Quality is a crucial member of the team, responsible for providing technical support and assistance to customers regarding in the hydraulic components, such as pumps, motors. This role involves troubleshooting, conducting repairs, and ensuring overall customer satisfaction.  Role & responsibilities   1.	Discuss with customer to understand the problem, analyze & explain to customer. 2. Coordination with other plants overseas for required information to conduct RCA 3. If required, recall the product for rectification, 4.	Conduct Troubleshooting and Diagnostics : Diagnose and troubleshoot root cause for the product when problems arise, either through on-site visits or virtual channels. Provide technical support to customers both on-site and remotely. 5.	Repair and Service: Rectify the problem at site if possible Ensure compliance with our company's quality standards, safety regulations, and industry norms during the entire process. 6.	Prepare and submit reports on  activities on a regular basis. 7.	Customer Interaction and Improvement: Monitor and analyze customer feedbacks. Develop and nurture good customer relationships Preferred candidate profile   Diploma/Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. Around 3 ~ 8 years of experience with at-least 2 ~3 yrs i in hydraulic industry Good English communication skills Willingness and mobility to travel to customer site as & when required. Good Knowledge of associated electrical, mechanical, and hydraulic systems. Good customer handling skills. Maintenance & Repair: Hydraulic System Repair, Mechanical Repair Microsoft Office: Microsoft Excel Problem Solving: Identifying and analyzing technical problems & sorting out problems to the extent possible at customer end. Perks and benefits

column2: Job Purpose :   The focus of the position will be to act as a team member on projects within UCCs Operational Excellence and Quality Assurance teams. This will include technically supporting contact QA deliverable activities within the power industry, utility, and industrial wastewater treatment markets.  Under the direction of the Manager, QA & ME,  QA Data Analyst  main responsibilities will be to coordinate contract QA deliverables and department documentation related activities to support scheduled deliverables across multiple concurrent projects. Roles & Responsibilities:   1.  Coordinates, collects, and organizes supplier documentation for   contract QA deliverables. Works with   various Mechanical/Chemical/Project Engineers and Project Managers on   assigned projects, Purchasing, and Outside Suppliers to expedite receipt of   documents and ensure on-time submittal.  2. Maintains a working knowledge of the document control procedures/processes   and ensures that document submittals from external suppliers and internal Engineering   or Project Management teams meet the requirements of the Project Controls   Department. 3. Prepares and maintains contract QA Deliverables (MTRs, WPSs,   PQRs, FAT documents, drawings, run tests, cycle tests, hydro tests, QA construction/QA customer site documents, in-process or final reports, etc.) for QDMS logging and TNR (transmittal   notification request) submittal to customers.   4. Performs contract inspection related QA tasks (prepare QA   deliverable reviews, logs inspection data into SharePoint or network drives, and   prepare pre-inspection documentation packages.) as assigned. 5. Develops department procedures and training materials for   document processing and provides training as necessary. 6. All other duties as assigned. Preferred candidate profile    5+ years of work experience  in a technical documentation / QA Documentation Analysis. Pro-active, Self-starter, Ability to create training documents and train others. Ready for flexible working hours (Collaboration required with USA Team- UCC Headquarters Office) Team Player , Excellent organizational skills, Attention to detail, Ability to prioritize. Ready to Travel within India (20%) Mechanical and analytical aptitude and/or experience with technical documents and communication Strong ability to read blueprints, technical documents, and customer document procedures. Ready to Travel in India & Oversea. Perks and Benefits? As per UCC HR Policy
